title: Who are the cheapest billionaires in history? - Quora

response.answer_text: J. Paul Getty. The billionaire refused to pay the $17 million ransom when his grandson was kidnapped. Eventually, he agreed on $3 million when the kidnappers sent him his grandson’s severed ear. However, he only paid $2.2 million since that was the maximum that was tax deductible. The other $800k, he loaned to his son on the condition that he pays him back with 4% interest. In fact they made a movie about this in 2017  The guy does have a nice museum in Los Angeles though…  Getty Museum Azim Premji  He has a net worth of around $18 billion and is one of the richest men in India. It is said that he drives a Toyota Corolla, flies coach, and stays in company guest houses while on business. At work, he reminds his employees to turn off the lights at the office and keeps tabs on toilet paper usage. He even used paper plates for his son’s wedding! Mark Zuckerberg His appearance really says it all. He chooses to wear simply with simple t-shirts, hoodies, and jeans. Despite being the 6th richest person on the planet, he drives a manual-transmission Volkswagen hatchback, worth about $30,000. Lastly, he was reported to eat McDonald’s after marrying his wife in 2012 in the backyard of his house. Ingvar Kamprad  The founder of Ikea flew economy, rode the bus, drove a decades old Volvo and regularly ate lunch in Ikea’s cafeteria. He passed away on January 27, 2018 at the age of 91. RIP Bill Gates Formerly the richest man in the world, he wears a $10 Casio watch and prefers washing the dishes at home. John Caudwell Co-founder of British cellphone company, Phones 4u, cuts his own hair and buys his clothes off the rack at Marks & Spencer.  David Cheriton The billionaire professor at Stanford University saves half of his meal for the next day when eating somewhere expensive, cuts his own hair, and drives a 1986 Volkswagen van.  Warren Buffett He’s the well known one. Currently the 3rd richest man, he lives in an old home in Nebraska that he bought in 1958 for $31,500. He’s been carrying the same wallet for 20 years, eats at McDonalds everyday for breakfast, uses a flip phone, and has been driving the same car for many years. We all know this gem as Nikola Tesla. There are numerous discoveries that he'd made and had given to the world. He was an amazing scientist with few mental disorder which is normal with the brains of this degree. Tesla read voraciously and is reported to have had an eidetic memory, going beyond the visual recall of a photographic memory. He is said to have envisioned complete diagrams of inventions, sometimes working only from memory, not bothering to draw them. He spoke seven languages. Like many great scientific minds, he required little sleep, and is reported once to have worked 84 hours straight without stopping to eat or rest. But… but.. but Why is he the cheapest billionaire ? Not only he had lacked financial education, but also he was poor at managing business. He was a genius, but people who run businesses require some extraordinary skills. This Alternating Current giant was a proof for all the smart people out there that having only a genius brain with no business knowledge will lead you no where. You'll surely make money, but it won't be a billion with a 'B'. @Sankalp Chauhan (संकल्प चौहान)
